page.title: 16Architect's Office
page.content: In 1983, Roger Flynn bought the old control tower on Hadstock aerodrome, or Little Walden airfield, as it was officially known. The building had once housed communication equipment in the days when the airfield was the base for USAF Havocs and Mustangs. The two-storey, flat-roofed build- ing has been restored, and provides comfortable working space for five or six people. The views from the windows are beautiful, and there are not the car-parking problems that an office in town would have. Peter Flynn thinks it is an ideal place to work. Maybe the only problem is that when thunderstorms roll over the area, the phone and electricity may fail. The building is quite often visited by veteran airmen, who have provided photographs of its operational days, and commemorative plaques.
